content: Got it, I'm ready to get started.
Great to hear that! To get us started, would you mind sharing a little bit about how things have been going for you lately? Anything on your mind that you’d like to talk about?

Well, it’s been a rough patch, honestly. Work has been stressing me out a lot—I'm scared I might lose my job. That thought keeps me up at night, and I just can’t seem to turn my brain off when I try to sleep.

That sounds incredibly tough—worrying about your job and struggling to sleep must feel overwhelming. It seems like the stress from work is really taking a toll on you. What’s been the most challenging part about all of this for you recently?

I think it's the constant uncertainty. I feel like I'm walking on eggshells every day at work, not knowing if I'll still have a job tomorrow. And that fear just sticks with me, even when I’m home with my family—it’s like I can’t catch a break.

That sense of uncertainty sounds exhausting, especially when it’s following you home and affecting your time with your family. It seems like this is something that’s really weighing on you. How have you been managing all of this?

Honestly, I don’t think I’m managing it well at all. I try to distract myself—watch TV, scroll on my phone—but it doesn’t really help. The thoughts just keep coming back, especially at night, and I’m running on so little sleep that I feel like I’m barely holding it together.

It seems like you're really doing your best to cope, but the stress and lack of sleep are making things so much harder. Running on little rest would make anyone feel drained and overwhelmed. How do you feel all of this has been affecting you overall?

I feel like I’m not myself lately. I’m more irritable, I snap at my partner and kids when I really don’t mean to, and it’s like I’m always on edge. I’m scared that if things don’t get better, I’m going to let down the people I care about most.

It sounds like you deeply care about your family, and you're carrying a lot right now. It’s understandable that feeling so tense and sleep-deprived would make it harder to show up for them in the ways you want to. Hearing how much this matters to you shows just how important your family is in your life. Have you had a chance to share with them how all of this is impacting you?
